Class DrawingSurface

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Panel
java.applet.Applet
processing.core.PApplet
Maze.DrawingSurface
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, processing.core.PConstants
public class DrawingSurface
extends processing.core.PApplet
The PApplet that contains all the mazes and other UI components
Author:
Christopher Lew, Lakshya Shrivastava, Joseph Huang

      public void spawnNewPlayer​(int x, int y)

      Parameters:
      x - the x position of the top left of the new Player
      y - the y position of the top left of the new Player

    • toggleMaze

      public int toggleMaze()
      Change the current maze on the screen from allMazes.get(i) to allMazes.get(i+1) (or allMazes.get(0) if i+1 is greater than allMazes.size() )
      Returns:
      the index of the new Maze selected that will be shown on the screen

    • getIterations

      public static long getIterations()
      Returns:
      number of draw() iterations

    • getRespawnTimer

      public static int getRespawnTimer()
      Returns:
      how many frames on the respawn cooldown there's left

    • getPlayer

      public static Player getPlayer()
      Returns:
      the Player that the user controls
      Postcondition:
      This method modified the one and only Player on screen so use carefully

    • getCellRatio

      public double getCellRatio()
      Returns the ratio of cells
      Returns:
      ratio of cells
